compounding_risks.outcome: The triple-void collapse: zero verifiable utility data + provably thin on-chain liquidity + speculative-only institutional demand reveals the entire 'institutional settlement' narrative as hollow. Without ODL data OR on-chain liquidity OR utility-driven ETF demand, there is no evidence that XRP functions as settlement infrastructure at all. The thesis becomes pure narrative with zero supporting evidence. This is the most dangerous compounding risk because it attacks the thesis from three independent angles simultaneously.

Competitive encirclement: Circle captures stablecoin-native settlement from one side, bank proprietary tokens capture internal settlement from another, and regulatory leveling removes RLUSD's compliance differentiation. XRP is squeezed from all three vectors — no unique competitive position remains. RLUSD at $1.56B cannot compete with USDC at $35B+ when both have identical regulatory standing.

Macro-reflexive death spiral: global risk-off triggers institutional crypto exodus → Japan yield crisis destabilizes SBI/Japan corridor (XRP's strongest institutional market) → ETF speculative holders redeem into falling prices → redemption pressure accelerates price decline → further redemptions. The XRP price becomes reflexively self-reinforcing to the downside with no utility-driven demand floor to arrest it.

Technology adoption without token accrual: institutions adopt XRPL technology via permissioned domains but use own tokens inside, sovereign settlement routes through BIS Nexus bypassing XRP entirely, and if Ripple pivots toward infrastructure licensing rather than XRP utility, XRP token value decouples permanently from Ripple/XRPL ecosystem growth. Technology wins, token loses.
